turn in.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to give something to a person in authority, especially an illegal weapon or something lost or stolen
turn in.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The rebels were told to turn in their weapons and ammunition.
My wallet was turned in to the police two days later.
turn in.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to give back something you have borrowed or rented
turn in.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: When do the library books have to be turned in?
turn in.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to produce a particular profit, result etc
turn in.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Bimec turned in net profits of £2.4 million.
Last night the team turned in another dazzling performance.
turn in.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to tell the police who or where a criminal is
turn in.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Margrove’s wife finally turned him in.
turn in.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: I think I’ll turn in early tonight.
turn in.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to give a piece of work you have done to a teacher, your employer etc
turn in.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Have you all turned in your homework assignments?
